title: Frank O'Connor (rugby league)
text:
Francis Arthur 'Frank' O'Connor (1906-1964) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s and represented his state and country. He was a triple premiership winner with <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a>.
Playing career.
South Sydney.
O'Connor was a champion forward who played for <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> for ten seasons between 1927-1937. O'Connor was a member of the champion Souths teams of the late 1920s and 1930s. He partnered his older brother <a href="Alf%20O%27Connor">Alf O'Connor</a> in the winning <a href="1929%20NSWRFL%20season">1929 Grand Final team</a>, and played in two more winning grand finals - the <a href="1931%20NSWRFL%20season">1931 Grand Final</a> and the <a href="1932%20NSWRFL%20season">1932 Grand Final</a>.
Representative.
O'Connor was also a representative player for <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a>, playing fifteen times for the Blues between 1930-1934. He also represented <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a>, making his Test debut in the 2nd Test against England in Brisbane in 1932. O'Connor also toured with the 1933-34 <a href="Kangaroo%20Tour">Kangaroos</a>, playing in the first two Tests against England. He is listed on the "Australian Players Register" as Kangaroo No. 173. 
Death.
O'Connor died on 23 August 1964, aged 57.
